Clean raw output of doaggregate() from the EJAM package

Source: R/batch.summarize.helpers.R
batch.clean.Rd

Takes the raw output version of batch buffer results and cleans it up to make it ready for batch.summarize function Note this drops rows with no pop data - assumes those lack EJScreen batch results

Usage

batch.clean(x, namesfile = "keepnames", oldcolnames, newcolnames)

Arguments

x

Required. output of batch processor that runs EJScreen report once per site.

namesfile

Optional but must specify either namesfile, or both oldcolnames and newcolnames. A csv filename, of file that maps fieldnames from those in raw output of batch processor to more useful and friendly names that make more sense. If function is called with the special value namesfile='keepnames' then the names are unchanged from those in x.

oldcolnames

Optional. The names to be found in x, ignored if namesfile specified.

newcolnames

Optional. The corresponding names to change them to, ignored if namesfile specified.
